block.p: WESCO INTERNATIONAL INC., -- Pittsburgh, a distributor of electrical supplies to businesses, said it had bought the closely held KVA Supply Co., a supplier of parts for underground high-voltage power transmission, for an undisclosed price to expand its division that sells to utility companies.

KINDER ENERGY PARTNERS L.P., -- Houston, said it had agreed to purchase a 32.5 percent stake in the Cochin Pipeline System from the Nova Chemicals Corp., Calgary, Alberta, a maker of commodity chemicals. Financial terms of the deal were not disclosed.

INTERNATIONAL FLAVORS AND FRAGRANCES INC., -- New York, the maker of products used to enhance foods and cosmetics, plans to take a fourth-quarter charge of about $21 million related to an early retirement program. About 145 of the company's employees are eligible for the voluntary program.

LIZ CLAIBORNE INC., -- New York, the maker of women's clothing, said the Haggar Clothing Co., a unit of the Haggar Corp., Dallas, agreed to manufacture pants and shorts under its Claiborne men's label. Financial terms were not disclosed.
